text: Really lovely fresh vegetarian fare. They are very accommodating to dietary restrictions and the menu is really clearly marked.

I give it a 3 stars. 

Pros: Very cute place, the eating area is well designed, the owners were able to create an inviting modern, yet cozy ambiance. They have good Wifi, comfortable seatings. 

The offer both vegan and vegetarian options. 

Cons: Although the food and coffee is great, they are both inconsistent, depending on who is in the kitchen, for the exact same meal, it can go from " Meh " to " Amazing " which isn't great.

The same can be said about the service, it's not bad, it's just that your experience varies extremely based on who serves you. I have been twice, and my first waitress was exceptional, while the other gave us 0 follow up or explanation as per why an avocado toast took 2 hours to make...

All and all, I think they have great potential. They recently opened, so I am sure they will improve over time. I hope that next time, the service and food will be more consistent.

Totally awesome vegetarian food. a really  international menu, full of flavor. The place is beautiful inside and would as a great spot for a business lunch or date spot. I highly recommend this place whether you are vegan, veg or a die hard meat eater.

Delicious food!! Everything is super fresh and healthy. The staff are welcoming, warm and very professional. The place is clean and very nicely decorated. Overall an awesome place! Will def be coming back!

As a burgeroglist I steer clear of the V word resturants but after being dragged in kicking and screaming and konned to enjoy it . I actually did the service is pleasent the staff is a delight and the food wow delicious

Cute little place with a rustic feel to it with wooden tables and nice ambiance. Reasonably priced with many vegan options. I tried the bean and seitan chilli with avocado on the side... the starter portion with another appetizer is just enough. If you're craving something for your sweet tooth don't try the mango chia pudding... that's sweet enough for a breakfast item but not for a dessert. I left still craving something sweet.

Vegan cuisine is typically hit or miss, but fortunately Ashley's is a hit. Has the look of a fancy restaurant at first, but the overall the vibe is casual. They serve a variety of things from bowls to appetizers to sandwiches to main dishes. They also have beer/wine/cocktails as well as tea and an espresso bar. The food is clean and healthy, and made well. Had the "Urban Hippie Bowl" and it was excellent. The folks with me had the dumplings, a beet salad, and the bruchetta, and we were pretty impressed. Also ordered the chocolate chip cookies and they were actually baked fresh, and to our surprise were really good! Would definitely come back!

I have been to Ashley's during winter; today I come here with a great company for lunch. We asked to be seated outside in the terrace. The restaurant inside is beautiful with modern design. The staff and crew are wonderful, helpful and very friendly.

Outside, it's so beautiful and sunny, so we asked for white wine sangria. In honesty, I had better sangria than this. Their sangria tasted more bitter orange fruit. My sister had royal bliss smoothie, which she found slightly watery. The smoothie was taken back; it came back much better that my sister finished it in one shot.

Food wise, there were Umami burger, the hoagie, the belgrave pizza and Mumbai Bhel; each dishes were exceptional! Special mention to umami burger; that was my dish; I believe it was the best veggie burger I have ever had. 

The price are slightly steep but it goes with the great quality of the food. 

Best vegetarian restaurant of Montreal.

I was very excited to try this new vegetarian spot when it finally opened in NDG. Fun fact: My sister designed their logo, so I would have to check it out. I went during the weekend with my boyfriend without reservations and were seated right away. 

Good: The service was quick and our waiter was attentive. The restaurant was clean and had a cozy decor with trendy exposed brick walls. 

Bad: I really want to like this place because their photos look really nice, and yet, this is another new hip vegetarian place that left me disappointed. I've ordered the burger which left me pretty underwhelmed, it wasn't awful, but not special neither. At best, I would say it was not memorable. 

Bottom line: Overall food was subpar, nothing I would go all the way to NDG for. Hey, at least I can say I finally tried it, but I most definitely would not be back. There's way better brunch and vegetarian spots elsewhere.
Great food with splendid seating arrangements and decor.

Ouvert assez récemment, proposant de la nourriture végétalienne, je ne pouvais tout naturellement pas passer à côté de cette nouvelle place !
Nous y sommes allés, mon chéri et 2 amis (non végétariens) après une partie d'Escape Game ! Il nous fallait reprendre des forces ;)
Pour commencer, le lieu est sublime, la décoration épurée et rustique (mais moderne) en raison de ses tables et ses murs en briquettes. Des ampoules sont suspendues un peu partout à de grosses poutres en bois. 
Passé ce premier Waouh, on est accueilli par un personnel souriant et très sympathique qui donne a cette expérience un côté encore plus savoureux. 
Côté nourriture, tout est végétarien, il y a bien sûr bcp d'options veganes mais aussi pour les non veganes des possibilités de plats avec des produits laitiers. 
Nous avons tous pris des plats différents et avons tous été plus que satisfaits, tout était bon, bien cuisiné et bien présenté. Consistant et gourmand. Un vrai régal. J'ai hâte d'y retourner pour tester d'autres choses ! Mentions spéciales aux dumplings que j'ai adoré ! 
Nos amis non végétariens ont également adoré, ce qui pour moi est toujours un signe que le restaurant "végétarien/végétalien" est une réussite ^^

My new local fave restaurant... Excellent food, meets all the necessary diets of people around me (gluten free options included).  

We had the leek and potato dumplings, Buddha's Nirvana (curried veggies, but not yor everyday curry), house chili bowl with sour cream and avocado, and the piece de resistence: chocolate and beet brownie that was scrumptious!

Alors que Montréal est reconnue pour être une ville végé- et vegan-friendly, la plupart des restaurants végétariens et véganes sont concentrés dans le Plateau Mont-Royal et dans le Mile-End. C'est d'autant plus vrai quand on recherche une cuisine gastronomique et plus recherchée que l'offre habituelle. Le quartier Notre-Dame-de-Grâce, qui compte pourtant quelques endroits comme Mouton Vert, Vegan Rapide ou Espace Végane, n'a jamais été particulièrement prisé. Ça a toutes les chances de changer avec l'arrivée de Ashley's Health Bar, un nouveau restaurant (officiellement ouvert le dernier jour d'août 2017) qui vient de s'y installer et d'ouvrir ses portes.
Dès qu'on pénètre dans l'établissement, on est agréablement surpris par le décor: tables et murs en bois, ampoules accrochées au plafond, grandes banquettes et chaises noires, etc. On sent que l'expérience, résolument moderne, a été pensée et que peu de choses ont été laissées au hasard (incluant la tenue du personnel et les napkins sur les tables!). L'espace est relativement vaste et peut accueillir, à mon avis, une trentaine de personnes. Lorsque le temps le permet, une grande terrasse est également disponible.
Au-delà des traditionnels bols Bouddha que d'autres restaurants ont contribué à démocratiser à Montréal, Ashley's Health Bar offre un menu avec des influences variées: bol de chili (en format entrée ou en plat principal), curry, burger, sandwichs (incluant un Banh mi) et même 2 pizzas! Il y en a pour tous les goûts et j'apprécie également que la majorité du menu soit biologique et que les fruits et légumes proviennent de commerces du quartier. Je regrette toutefois que le menu complet ne soit pas végane ou, du moins, que les plats ne soient pas proposés en version végane par défaut (ce qui semble de plus en plus être la norme pour les restaurants du genre). Plusieurs plats sont toutefois exempts de produit d'origine animale et la quasi-totalité peuvent être véganisés sur demande (sans frais!). Tous les desserts, incluant la crème glacée à base de noix de cajou, sont également végétaliens. Dommage toutefois que les laits végétaux représentent un coût supplémentaire pour les boissons (comme un latte).
Les plats sont préparés avec attention et, même si quelques items (comme les dumplings aux légumes) manquent légèrement de goût, d'autres compensent largement. Entre autres, la pizza Belgrava est possiblement une des meilleures pizzas véganes à Montréal et le curry De Burma avec amour était délicieusement épicé. Le dessert Symphonie de la mangue porte bien son nom et était frais et nourrissant (en plus d'être santé!). Le rapport qualité-prix est raisonnable mais, par contre, les portions sont étranges (par exemple, un curry en plat principal avait la même taille que le bol de chili en entrée). J'imagine que l'ajustement se fera avec le temps!
Le lancement de Ashley's Health Bar a été assez discret mais, pourtant, c'est un très bel ajout à l'offre actuelle des restaurants végétariens et véganes à Montréal. Je suis aussi content de voir le quartier NDG prendre un tournant santé et plant-based. En croisant les doigts pour un menu en version végane par défaut dans le futur!

Retrouvez l'avis détaillé (ainsi que les détails sur les options véganes et plusieurs photos) sur Vegan Level Up: https://veganlevelup.ca/sortir/ashleys-health-bar-ndg-plant-based/
Amazing quality vegetarian/vegan food, with super friendly staff and awesome decoration. I will definitely be back and recommend to my friends!!!

La decoration est tres agreable et la presentation des assietes tres jolie ainsi qu'un bon service souriant ... je voulais vraiement aimer la bouffe de cette place mais ... on est peut etre tombé pas bonne journée .. notre pizza servi avec la croute froide ... les salades fades , le quinoa sans gout particulier .. manque d'epices ..

There's something just so NDG about this place, you know? The exposed brick, the under-dressed but kinda bougey crowd, a lousy wine list (but a really good imported beer list?), and a sort of strange price-point. It's like if Café Orange took it up a couple notches and became a veggie restaurant. Despite the frankly strange crowd (the kind you can only find adjacent to Monkland village), the *slight* priciness, and the seriously sporadic service, I liked the place.

In terms of food, Ashley's answered to so many of my gripes about vegan food; this is a restaurant that actively features a wide-range of international flavours and veers away from the soup-salad-sandwich-burger formula that most places take. In terms of what I ordered, the crispy rice starter was a hit and I thought the burger was fantastic but my vegan partner qualified it as pretty standard.

The three stars are attributable to the vegan's take on the meal: nothing my manfriend ordered could really be described as much more than meh. The dumplings were also standard and the meatballs were wayyyyyy too soy heavy. By the end of the meal we were both in a gluten/soy-induced coma attributable to only a certain kind of vegan food.

At the end of the day, I love that Ashley's is breaking the current Montreal mould for vegan flavours and dishes. That being said, I also look forward to seeing them evolve into a place that challenges the gluten and soy base to everything and takes their service up a notch. I'll definitely be back!
